content.description:
Magnum propiusque noscendum ut eruditissimoeruditus, -a, -um, adj.: well-educated viro 
visum. Iubet liburnicamliburnica, -ae, f.: fast-sailing warship aptariapto, -are = paro, -are; mihi si venire una vellem 
facit copiam; respondi studere me malle, et forte ipse quod 
scriberem dederat.
content.question: In line 1, how is noscendum translated?

choices.label: Something that must be learned about
Something that has been learned about

content.answer: Something that must be learned about

unit.text: 2: Pliny's Letters: Eruption of Mt. Vesuvius

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
